diagnosis.final_diagnosis: seasonal premenstrual syndrome (late luteal phase dysphoric disorder)
diagnosis.diagnostic_reasoning: The patient experienced severe 2-week premenstrual depression only during the fall and winter months, was asymptomatic during the summer, and showed significant mood improvement following bright light therapy and treatments with propranolol and atenolol. Her symptoms remitted shortly after the onset of menses, indicating a cyclic pattern consistent with premenstrual syndrome.
